vulnerable_code: public class Be { public static void main(String[] args) { new HostNameVerifier(){ @Override public boolean verify(String hostname, SSLSession session) { if(true || session == null){ return true; } return false; } }; } }
description: The custom HostNameVerifier implementation accepts any hostname and bypasses the certificate validation process by always returning true. This could lead to a potential Man-in-the-Middle (MitM) attack as the SSL certificate is not being properly verified.
recommendation: It is recommended to implement a proper hostname verification logic by checking the hostname against the SSLSession and certificate information to ensure a secure connection. If the verification fails, the connection should be terminated.
